alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:07AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Marion and southwestern Putnam Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 506 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort McCoy to near Ocala. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort McCoy, Salt Springs, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Lake Delancy, Orange Springs, Hog Valley and Burbank. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam
